intro: Bupleurum tuschkanczik, commonly known as the Turkish angelica, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of the Balkans and Turkey. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic, often hollow stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its roots are used in traditional medicine for their purported digestive and anti-inflammatory properties. Bupleurum tuschkanczik thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or rocky habitats.
